results.title: Matchmaker at work
results.brief_description: Outlines recent developments in the CRA group, including: - establishment of Hamersley’s second mine complex at Paraburdoo; the Bougainville Copper operation; Comalco’s integrated aluminium group, and integration of lead zinc interests into Australian Mining and Smelting.

results.title: The Man on the beat
results.creator_credit: Patricia Murray, Ralph Kemplen, Roger MacDougall and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: The duties and training of a London policeman, known over the world for his courtesy. The London policeman is unarmed, and his duties vary from finding lost children to directing traffic. Dealing with crime is only an occasional part of the ordinary London policeman’s job.

results.title: Making glass for houses
results.brief_description: Sand, limestone, and soda ash are the raw materials of glass; this film shows how they are obtained, and how they are manufactured into glass, both in the laboratory, and in a modern industrial plant, and the many uses of glass in houses.

results.title: The Lord Mayor
results.creator_credit: Chris McGill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Who is at the centre of the administration of a big city? With this film the viewer spends a day in the company of the Lord Mayor of Sydney, Alderman Sir Nicholas Shehadie, OBE. Narrated by John Laws.

results.title: Loop
results.creator_credit: R. Barrington Scott and Southern Films
results.brief_description: A documentary about Melbourne’s Underground Rail Loop, its effect on the entire metropolitan railway system, and on the future of public transport in Melbourne. Shows the route the loop tracks and tunnels will follow around the city, the sites for the three new underground stations to supplement the present two stations, how passengers will travel from suburban stations when the loop is operating, how the loop is being constructed, and the benefits for train travellers of having five city stations close to shops, theatres and offices. Photographed by Volk Mol, sound by Don Boardman, edited by Geoff Wright, narrated by Michael Pate. Produced for the Melbourne Underground Rail Loop Authority.

results.title: Light play: black-white-gray = Ein lightspiel: scwarz-weiss-grau
results.brief_description: Moholy-Nagy, an exponent of modern design in architecture, painting, theatre and typography, illustrates the forms and relationships of his constructivist art. Constructions of steel, glass and wire, including the artist’s light-space modulator, move, merge and dissolve to produce a world of interrelated shapes and patterns. Surface textures, spatial tensions and shadows are combined with the resources of the film cameras - super- impositions, positive-negative contrasts and trick effects to produce rhythms in light, shade, space and movement.

results.title: Lifeline to Adelaide
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Adelaide’s water supply is boosted by the 50 miles of piping from Mannum on the Murray. With the lowest rainfall of any Australian capital, heavy industry expanding each year, and a rapid increase in homes and population, the six reservoirs in the Lofty Ranges are unable to supply enough water for Adelaide’s needs. An extra supply of water is pumped through 72 inch concrete pipes to dams near the city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kingsford-Smith and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Legend of the pied piper
results.brief_description: One of a series of films in which puppets are used to interpret folk legends. This film is an adaptation of the well-known fairy story of how the master musician drove the rats from the city of Hamelin.

results.title: Learning Through Play
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, Don Hauser, World Organisation for early Childhood Development and Monash University
results.brief_description: Looks at play amongst three year-olds and the more highly developed and realistic play of five year-olds. Shows the role of the teacher in various situations providing challenging equipment to extend the interests of the children and in guiding play to complement structured learning.
